posts.post_content: "Oh, you attack me for five? Sure, I don't block. I'll just make some tokens and hit you right back for five. In fact, I happen to have a [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden) on duty, so I'll just go ahead and gain back that five life. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm off to forge an alliance with Balduvia."

posts.post_content: Can you not TASTE the synergy with soldier pumpers? [Field Marshal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Field Marshal), [Daru Warchief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Daru Warchief), [Veteran Armorsmith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Veteran Armorsmith), [Veteran Swordsmith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Veteran Swordsmith)? Get hit, get soldiers. You can even try using [Angelic Chorus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Chorus )  with [Dovescape](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dovescape)for some added fun. (Though I do not recommend you using that, since it gives you opponents some ample space for attack with the mass amount of flying cratures.)

Posted By: Jokergius (9/19/2009 11:52:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What a great card! There are so many good combinations that can be used with it! [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden), [Field Marshal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Field Marshal), [Angelic Chorus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Chorus), [Mobilization](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mobilization), and the list goes on!   
  
It's too bad that they haven't reprinted this card, although I wouldn't want them to change the artwork or anything. (On second thought, maybe it's better that they *haven't* reprinted it!) But, as a side note, I like it better with the creature type saying "Human Lord," rather than "Human Soldier." Sure, sure, it makes it a better card to have it say "Human Soldier," but it fits better to have a Legendary King creature character be a "Lord." That's the whole point of a Lord character. After all, he's not just another soldier, any more that [Lord of the Undead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Undead) is just another zombie.
posts.html:

It's too bad that they haven't reprinted this card, although I wouldn't want them to change the artwork or anything. (On second thought, maybe it's better that they haven't reprinted it!) But, as a side note, I like it better with the creature type saying "Human Lord," rather than "Human Soldier." Sure, sure, it makes it a better card to have it say "Human Soldier," but it fits better to have a Legendary King creature character be a "Lord." That's the whole point of a Lord character. Posted By: Condor_96 (9/12/2011 5:54:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He's pretty awesome in my [Ghave, Guru of Spores](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghave, Guru of Spores) deck.  
Oh, you hit me for 10? Ok, I'll just sacrifice all those tokens and put them on Ghave and swing back for lethal. Or sacrifice them to [Vish Kal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vish Kal) for precision removal. Or have [Mentor of the Meek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mentor of the Meek) out, which basically says "Whenever you are dealt damage, you may pay X, where X is between 0 and the amount of damage dealt to you. If you do, draw X cards."  
  
Or, if you're in a tight spot, you can use them as chump blockers next turn.  
  
Of course, in practice, most people try to kill him on sight before the craziness gets going, but that just means that your dozens of other bombs stick around to mess things up. The 3/3 body can hurt with big damage sweepers in the format.  
  
All in all, 4/5.
posts.html:
He's pretty awesome in my Ghave, Guru of Spores deck.
Oh, you hit me for 10? Ok, I'll just sacrifice all those tokens and put them on Ghave and swing back for lethal. Or sacrifice them to Vish Kal for precision removal. Or have Mentor of the Meek out, which basically says "Whenever you are dealt damage, you may pay X, where X is between 0 and the amount of damage dealt to you. If you do, draw X cards."

Or, if you're in a tight spot, you can use them as chump blockers next turn.

Of course, in practice, most people try to kill him on sight before the craziness gets going, but that just means that your dozens of other bombs stick around to mess things up. The 3/3 body can hurt with big damage sweepers in the format.

All in all, 4/5.

posts.post_content:
For the lullz w/ [Ajani Pridemate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani Pridemate) and [Soul Warden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Warden) or [Suture Priest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Suture Priest).  
  
You take damage, you pump creatures equal to that damage, you heal damage equal to the creatures (and thus gain all lost life back) and you trigger the Pridemates for each life gained thus producing not only an army and a psuedo kind of invincibility, but also a big nasty in the process. Woohoo!
posts.html:

posts.post_content: I'm not normally one who rates down a creature because it "dies to removal", because a lot of cards, i.e. Baneslayer, is an immediate threat on the next turn if the opponent doesn't have removal in hand. The problem with this card is that unless you have some way to damage yourself, your opponent gets to choose whether it's worth damaging you or not, and if it's not, he can just sit and wait for a removal, while Darien isn't affecting the board position much. 4/5
posts.html:
